Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_cycle_stress.openbmc_reboot

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase



[docs]class OpenbmcReboot(TestBase):


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(OpenbmcReboot, self).__init__()
        self.cycle_count = self.test_control['cycle_count']
        self.cycle_type = self.test_control['cycle_type']



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the OpenBMC Reboot test")
        cycle_count = self.cycle_count
        self.log_info("Target to cycle %d times" % cycle_count)


        self.validate_condition(True, "cycle 0 - starting")
        self._cycle()
        self.host.oob.check_ps()
        self.validate_condition(True, "cycle 0 - done")

        for n in range(1, cycle_count + 1):
            self.validate_condition(True, "cycle %d - starting" % n)
            self._cycle()

            # Check all the necessary process running
            self.host.oob.check_ps()
            self.validate_condition(True, "cycle %d - done" % n)


    def _cycle(self):
        if self.cycle_type == 'reboot':
            self.host.oob.reboot()
        elif self.cycle_type == 'reboot -f':
            self.host.oob.force_reboot()
        else:
            raise Exception("Unknown cycle type %s" % (self.cycle_type))




[docs]def main():
    test = OpenbmcReboot()
    test.lifecycle()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
